results.title: Paṭiccasamuppāda sutta - Dependent Co-Arising
results.description: The Buddha explains the twelve links of dependent co-arising, and how there is an arising and ending of the whole mass of suffering.

results.title: Vibhaṅga sutta - Analysis of Dependent Co-Arising
results.description: The Buddha analyzes each of the twelve links of dependent co-arising, and explains how there is an arising and ending of the whole mass of suffering.

results.title: Paṭipadā sutta - Ways Of Practice
results.description: The Buddha explains the wrong way of practice as that which leads to the arising of suffering, and the right way of practice as that which leads to the end of suffering.

results.title: Vipassī sutta - Vipassī
results.description: In the far past, the Buddha Vipassī prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into depend

results.title: Sikhī sutta - Sikhī
results.description: In the far past, the Buddha Sikhī prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into dependen

results.title: Vessabhū sutta - Vessabhū
results.description: In the far past, the Buddha Vessabhū prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into depen

results.title: Kakusandha sutta - Kakusandha
results.description: In the far past, the Buddha Kakusandha prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into dep

results.title: Koṇāgamana sutta - Koṇāgamana
results.description: In the far past, the Buddha Koṇāgamana prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into dep

results.title: Kassapa sutta - Kassapa
results.description: In the far past, the Buddha Kassapa prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into depend

results.title: Gotama sutta - Gotama
results.description: The Buddha prior to his full awakening reflects on how the world has fallen into trouble and discovers the escape from suffering through wise attention and insight into dependent co-arising.

results.title: Āhāra sutta - Nutriment
results.description: The Buddha explains the four kinds of nutriments that sustain beings that are existing and support those seeking birth, and how they arise from craving.

results.title: Moḷiyaphagguna sutta - With Moḷiyaphagguna
results.description: The Buddha explains dependent co-arising as a process rather than an agentive sequence.

results.title: Kaccānagotta sutta - With Kaccānagotta
results.description: Venerable Kaccānagotta asks the Buddha about right view, and the Buddha explains how the world depends on a duality of existence and non-existence, and how the Tathāgata teaches the Dhamma by the midd

results.title: Paccaya sutta - Dependence
results.description: The Buddha teaches about dependent co-arising and the phenomena arisen from dependent co-arising. A noble disciple who has thoroughly seen this with right wisdom will no longer be doubtful about who t

results.title: Dasabala sutta - Ten Powers
results.description: Endowed with ten powers and four assurances, the Buddha reveals the impermanence of the five aggregates and teaches dependent co-arising.

results.title: Dutiyadasabala sutta - Ten Powers (Second)
results.description: The Buddha, endowed with the ten powers and four assurances, reveals the impermanence of the five aggregates and teaches dependent co-arising. He then urges the bhikkhus to practice with diligence for

results.title: Upanisa sutta - Proximate Causes
results.description: The Buddha explains the proximate causes for the ending of the mental defilements. The twelve factors leading to the ending of defilements are explained along with twelve factors that lead to sufferin

results.title: Ñāṇavatthu sutta - Basis of Knowledge
results.description: The Buddha describes the forty-four bases of knowledge by understanding.

results.title: Cetanā sutta - Intending
results.description: Intending, planning, and underlying tendencies are the basis for the continuation of consciousness.

results.title: Pañcaverabhaya sutta - Five Perilous Animosities
results.description: The Buddha explains how one can verify that they are a stream-enterer by reflecting on the five perilous animosities, the four factors of stream-entry, and clearly seeing with wisdom the noble princip
